sentences.en: ‘How's tricks in your neck of the woods?’.
sentences.cn: “你那一带还好吗？” 。

sentences.en: a magic trick
sentences.cn: 魔术

sentences.en: a Marine &B{tricked out in} World War II kit and weaponry.
sentences.cn: 一个披挂着二战装备和武器的水兵。

sentences.en: He didn’t really lose his wallet - that’s just a trick.
sentences.cn: 他并没有真的丢了钱包——这只是一个骗局。

sentences.en: I don't think Mr Cavanagh would get far with that trick.
sentences.cn: 我想卡瓦纳先生的那套把戏玩不了多久。

sentences.en: I played a trump and won the trick.
sentences.cn: 我打出一张主牌，赢了那一墩。

sentences.en: I’m getting tired of your silly tricks.
sentences.cn: 我对你那些愚蠢的恶作剧感到厌烦了。

sentences.en: Inhalations of menthol may do the trick.
sentences.cn: 吸入薄荷醇或许可以起到作用。

sentences.en: It's an old trick but it just might work.
sentences.cn: 这是个老掉牙的把戏了，不过也许会有用。

sentences.en: Love songs trick us into believing in knights in shining armor.
sentences.cn: 情歌哄骗我们去相信有勇救美人的英雄。

sentences.en: Mia realised her trick had rebounded on her.
sentences.cn: 米娅意识到她的把戏反而害了自己。

sentences.en: My uncle was always showing me card tricks when I was a kid.
sentences.cn: 我小时候，叔叔总是用纸牌变戏法给我看。

sentences.en: Pretending he doesn’t remember is an old trick of his.
sentences.cn: 假装不记得是他的老花招了。

sentences.en: She is the victim of a big con trick.
sentences.cn: 她是一场大骗局的受害者。

sentences.en: She knew she’d been tricked, but it was too late.
sentences.cn: 她知道自己被骗了，但为时已晚。

sentences.en: Sometimes a few choice words will do the trick.
sentences.cn: 有时说几句尖酸刻薄的话就有人听了。

sentences.en: That was a sneaky trick!
sentences.cn: 这种把戏可不够光明正大！

sentences.en: That's a cute trick.
sentences.cn: 这是个设计巧妙的骗局。

sentences.en: The teacher was known for not missing a trick.
sentences.cn: 这个老师警惕性很高是众所周知

sentences.en: The trick boomeranged, though.
sentences.cn: 然而这个花招竟害了自己。

sentences.en: The trick is done simply by sleight of hand.
sentences.cn: 变这个戏法全凭手法敏捷。

sentences.en: The trick is to bend your knees as you catch the ball.
sentences.cn: 诀窍是接球时要屈膝。

sentences.en: They had to think of a trick to get past the guards.
sentences.cn: 他们只好想出个计谋骗过岗哨。

sentences.en: They will stoop to every low-down trick.
sentences.cn: 他们什么卑劣的手段都使得出来。

sentences.en: was all tricked out in beads and fringe.
sentences.cn: 用小珠子和花边装饰起来

sentences.en: What a dirty, low-down trick!
sentences.cn: 多么肮脏、卑劣的伎俩！

words.tran_cn: 欺骗的，狡猾的；恶作剧的；顽皮的
诡计多端；狡猾；棘手；欺骗
[电影]特技的；欺诈的；有决窍的
诡计；恶作剧；窍门；花招；骗局；欺诈

phrases.tran_cn: 高明的把戏；聪明的花招；熟练的伎俩

phrases.phrase: do the trick 或 turn the trick

phrases.tran_cn: (非正式)（达到目的的）各种可能方法
帽子戏法（指连入三球），[板球]连中三柱（使对方三击球手退场）
(非正式)你好吗（表示友善的问候语）
怎么样：用来友好地询问某人的情况或事务

phrases.phrase: the oldest trick in the book
phrases.tran_cn: 书中的老把戏（非常过时，无法再骗人）
(主北美)招待还是捣蛋（万圣节时，孩子们上门索要小礼物，否则就搞恶作剧的风俗，常用作孩子们万圣节上门时的问候语）

phrases.phrase: trick out  或 trick up 【非正式用语】
phrases.tran_cn: 装扮，打扮：装饰或修饰，通常是华美地，耀眼地
盛装打扮某人；隆重装饰某物
（尤指外行很少懂的）行业秘诀

trans.tran_cn: 使人产生错觉的，虚弱有毛病的
trans.tran_en: when a photograph or picture has been changed so that it looks different from what was really there

trans.tran_cn: 诡计，骗局，把戏，技巧，窍门，引起错觉的事物
trans.tran_en: a skilful set of actions that seem like magic, done to entertain people
to deceive someone in order to get something from them or to make them do something
to deceive someone in order to get something from them or to make them do something
